contentrichtext.text: {{For|the writer|Helen Hunt Jackson}} {{BLP sources|date=April 2010}} {{Infobox MP |honorific-prefix = |name = Helen Jackson |honorific-suffix = [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]] |image = |constituency_MP = [[Sheffield Hillsborough (UK Parliament constituency)|Sheffield Hillsborough]] |parliament = |majority = |term_start = 9 April 1992 |term_end = 5 May 2005 |predecessor = [[Martin Flannery (UK politician)|Martin Flannery]] |successor = [[Angela Christine Smith|Angela Smith]] |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1939|05|19|df=yes}} |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |birthname = |nationality = [[United Kingdom|British]] |party = [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] |otherparty = |spouse = Keith Jackson ''(divorced)'' |relations = |children = |residence = |alma_mater = [[St Hilda's College, Oxford]] |occupation = }} '''Helen Margaret Jackson''' [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]] ([[née]] Price, born 19 May 1939) is a [[United Kingdom|British]] politician. She was [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] [[member of Parliament]] for [[Sheffield Hillsborough (UK Parliament constituency)|Sheffield Hillsborough]] from 1992 until she stepped down at the [[United Kingdom general election, 2005|2005 general election]]. She went to the independent [[Berkhamsted Collegiate School|Berkhamsted School for Girls]]. She studied at [[St Hilda's College, Oxford]] where she gained an [[Master of Arts (Oxbridge and Dublin)|MA]] degree in Modern History in 1960. She went to the C.F. Mott College of Education (which later became [[Liverpool John Moores University|Liverpool Polytechnic]]), gaining a [[Postgraduate Certificate in Education]] (PGCE) in 1972. Between 1960 and 1961, she worked as assistant librarian at the [[Queen's College, Oxford]]. From 1961 to 1962, Jackson was an assistant teacher in [[Stoke on Trent]]. She was a teacher in [[Lancashire]] between 1972 and 1974, and in Sheffield from 1974 from 1980. She was on the Labour party's [[National Executive Committee]]. Jackson was appointed [[Commander of the Order of the British Empire]] (CBE) in the [[New Year Honours 2010|2010 New Year Honours]] for her services to the Women and Pensions Network and the community in South Yorkshire.<ref>{{London Gazette|issue=59282 |date=31 December 2009 |startpage=7 |supp=yes }}</ref><ref>[http://www.sheffieldtelegraph.co.uk/news/Entrepreneur-and-exMP-win-CBEs.5948346.jp "Entrepreneur and ex-MP win CBEs", ''Sheffield Telegraph'', 31 December 2009]</ref> ==Family== She married Keith Jackson in 1960, but divorced in 1998.
